Package it.polimi.adaptanalyzertool.metrics

Class AdaptabilityMetrics

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.adaptanalyzertool.metrics.AdaptabilityMetrics
  • public final class AdaptabilityMetrics
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the methods to calculate all the adaptability metrics.

    It has to be used as a static class since no object must be instantiated before calling the methods that are all public and static.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static double LevelSystemAdaptability​(Architecture architecture)
      The Level of system adaptability (LSA) measures the number of components used to make up the system with respect to the number of components that the most adaptable architecture would use.
      static double MeanAbsoluteAdaptability​(Architecture architecture)
      The Mean of absolute adaptability of services (MAAS) measures the mean number of used component per service.
      static double MeanRelativeAdaptability​(Architecture architecture)
      The mean of relative adaptability of services (MRAS) represents the mean of RAS.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • LevelSystemAdaptability

        public static double LevelSystemAdaptability​(Architecture architecture)
        The Level of system adaptability (LSA) measures the number of components used to make up the system with respect to the number of components that the most adaptable architecture would use.
        Parameters:
        architecture - the architecture to be analyzed.
        Returns:
        the number of components used to make up the system with respect to the number of components that the most adaptable architecture would use.

      • MeanAbsoluteAdaptability

        public static double MeanAbsoluteAdaptability​(Architecture architecture)
        The Mean of absolute adaptability of services (MAAS) measures the mean number of used component per service.
        Parameters:
        architecture - the architecture to be analyzed.
        Returns:
        the mean number of used component per service.

      • MeanRelativeAdaptability

        public static double MeanRelativeAdaptability​(Architecture architecture)
        The mean of relative adaptability of services (MRAS) represents the mean of RAS.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the mean of RAS.
        See Also:
